lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.gambler

Class BookieConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.common.JsonRpcConnection
      • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.gambler.BookieConnection

  • public class BookieConnection
extends JsonRpcConnection
    A BookieConnection represents the communication channel from this gambler to some bookie. A separate BookieConnection is being created for each bookie this gambler establishes a connection with.

    All methods required to communicate with a bookie should be implemented within this class. In other words, for each method bookies expose via JSON-RPC, there will be an associated method within this class to perform the JSON-RPC call.

    Author:
    steffen

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookieConnection

        public BookieConnection(Gambler gambler,
                        java.lang.String bookieIP,
                        int bookiePort)
        Create a connection with the specified bookie.
        Parameters:
        gambler - the enclosing gambler
        bookieIP - IP address of the bookie to setup a connection with
        bookiePort - port number on which the bookie listens

    • Method Detail

      • sayHello

        public void sayHello()
        Simple hello method for illustration purposes. Constructs a JSON-RPC request, respectively its parameters, invokes the JSON-RPC method on the bookie being connected with, and retrieves the response sent back by the remote bookie.

      • sendConnectCommand

        public java.lang.String sendConnectCommand(java.lang.String gamblerIP,
                                           int gamblerPort)
        Invokes the JSON-RPC connect method on a bookie that shall be connected to the gambler through this BookieConnection.
        Parameters:
        gamblerIP - IP address of the gambler to establish a connection with
        gamblerPort - port number of the gambler to establish a connection with
        Returns:
        bookie-id of the bookie being connected with
